descr: At work, first in a corridor and then in a meeting, colleagues asked me about the glasses. they joked about how it looks like I'm recording and found it funny!

walking to get lunch shortly after getting glasses, have received a lot of looks from people in public. could be confirmation bias as I was very aware of wearing the glasses for the first time, but I had the impression that people seemed more apprehensive
future_use: I am considering how to best explain that I'm not wearing a camera or recording people if someone confronts me about it, but won't change my use of the glasses

descr: having to explain to each colleague I run into about the glasses is a bit draining, hopefully now most people know and I will have this conversation less often
Flatmate saw the glasses and had a positive reaction, thinking the experiment is very cool :)

on the street, someone approached me and asked about the glasses. I explained best I could (although my German is not so good) that it's not a camera but it took a few minutes and was a bit uncomfortable.
the glasses don't have padding for the nose, and with the chunky frame and the added weight of the sensor, they are uncomfortable to wear for a long time.
future_use: when it starts being painful, I will take a break from the glasses.

descr: Been asked politely by a employee of the Deutsche Bahn to not film in the train. Had to explain the misunderstanding. This will probably happen a few more times in the coming week.
future_use: Thinking about wearing a shirt that reads: "I'm not filming, just recording light levels." In all seriousness, I thought something like this was gonna Happen, so my behaviour at this point is unaffected. Although the shirt does sound like a good idea

descr: A customer in the supermarket asked me, if it was a camera. He seemed more impressed than annoyed.
I went grocery shopping and expected people tò look strangely, but there was no akward reaction.
future_use: It does not influence my behaviour.

descr: Since I am not used to wear glasses, It Is a Little annoying when doing my usual activities around the house and with my children. The frame of the glasses Is disturbing.
future_use: i am still wearing the glasses in the Hope ti get used to them, but Is still a Little annoying.
I wonder how many people would stare if it's a crowded spay

descr: I met my flatmates and everybody noticed the new glasses. I feel weird in the glasses, people think it's a camera and I am recording them
future_use: I don't know yet, but I feel uncomfortable
